title: Yein
text:
Yein () is a form of <a href="group%20dance">group dance</a> native to <a href="Myanmar">Myanmar</a> (Burma). This dance form features multiple dancers synchronously dancing and moving their heads, waists, feet, and hands to the beats of music, often performed by a traditional Burmese orchestra called <a href="hsaing%20waing">hsaing waing</a> or <a href="drum">drum</a>s.
Terms.
"Yein" has historically been known by various terms, including "<a href="nat%20%28spirit%29">nat</a> aka" (, lit. 'spirit dance') during the Tagaung era, "ka aka" () during the Myinsaing era, and "myewaing aka" (, lit. 'earth circle dance') during the <a href="Konbaung%20dynasty">Konbaung era</a>.
